functions.tag: {title:"Survival Guide",author:"TheDeathlyCow",generation:0,pages:['[{"text":"    Survival Guide    ","color":"dark_blue"},{"text":"â“˜","color":"dark_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"This book provides a basic overview of all the systems in this map. Click the chapter titles to navigate to them automatically.","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\nUse /trigger WinterHelp to get a copy of this book at any time.","color":"dark_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n   Table of Contents","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n Hypothermia","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"2"}},{"text":"\\n Animal Totems","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"7"}},{"text":"\\n Gathering Food","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"10"}},{"text":"\\n Crafting & Medicine","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"15"}},{"text":"\\n Favour","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"21"}},{"text":"\\n Dungeons","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"24"}},{"text":"\\n Other Information","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"27"}},{"text":"\\n Credits","color":"dark_aqua","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"30"}}]','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Hypothermia","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nIn the wild you will find that, without proper protection, you will succumb to the effects of hypothermia. You will begin by noticing you will walk slower, followed by a weakened sword arm, slowed mining speed, blindness, and","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"ultimately death. Some places are not as bad as others. The Lush Taiga you find yourself shipwrecked in for example is quite temperate, but the Frozen Forest, Mountains, and Glaciers are all much more deadly environments. The Frozen forest is fairly mild, carrying a","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"torch and wearing some wool or fur armour is enough to keep the cold at bay, but the mountains and glaciers are much colder and this will not be sufficient. \\nOnce you get cold, you will need to warm up again. The best way to do this is by standing near a campfire. They ","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"provide warmth to all players within a few blocks. Soul campfires are similar; they provide warmth but at a reduced range. Soul campfires are also the only campfire that will provide warmth in the Glaciers, it is too cold for the standard campfire. There are other ways of keeping warm, too. Sleeping","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"near a campfire provides a small bonus to warmth, and setting yourself on fire will help too, but that is not advised. \\nSwimming in these frigid arctic waters is also a good way to get yourself killed, unless you have a strong connection to the Spirit of the Fish...","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Animal Totems","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nThere are many animal totem poles out in the wild. Approaching one allows you to deepen your connection to its particular spirit, granting you the ability to summon its power. You can do this either by typing /trigger AnimalTotem or by tapping shift ","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"twice. \\nThere are seven totems in total, the Bee, Fish, Rabbit, Fox, Wolf, Raven, and Polar Bear. Each of these totems grant unique powers, and these powers can also be upgraded using Favour, which will be discussed later. For example, the Bee Totem, found in the","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"Lush Taiga, gives you the ability to summon building materials every 30 minutes, and can be upgraded to also include a Haste II effect and better and more plentiful building materials. The rest are left as a surprise to you, go out and explore, you furry! ","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Gathering Food","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nYou will need to continue that habit of eating food in order to prevent starvation while out in the wild. Sweet berries are safe and plentiful, but not very nutricious. You might be tempted to try growing your own food, but unfortunately the","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"permafrost and frigid arctic winter temperatures make that rather difficult to do efficiently. Hunting and fishing are the best ways of gathering food. Sheep and chicken provide some meat, but they\'re a bit more scrawny than you normally find. Sheep at least provide wool, which is","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"good for some temporary warmth protection. Polar bears, foxes, and rabbits provide the most meat, and are easiest to find hibernating in the Frozen Forest. They can also provide furs, which can be used to craft Fur Armour, a much more suitable alternative to wool,","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"but unfortunately still doesn\'t provide as much protection as Iron or Diamond normally would.  \\nFishing provides a reliable source of food in all biomes, and can even provide small treasures like diamonds and emeralds, or some old junk. Just remember, no matter how you","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"get your food, be sure to hang onto those animal souls! Sometimes an animal will surrender itself to you when killed, dropping its soul. This can be used to embue campfires with their essence, craft a pointer to get you home, or to infuse dirt and sand with its bubbly goodness!  ","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Crafting & Medicine","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nWhen do something stupid and get hurt, you\'re gonna have to figure out how to get better quick. The wild is often ruthless, but fortunately many plants and herbs and be used to craft medicines and potions that can heal your","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"yourself or your companions, or hurt and kill your enemies. Simply mixing some of these ingredients with a water bottle in a filled cauldron will produce the desired potion, but be careful to use exact ingredients! On the next page you can find some recipes I\'ve used in my time here.","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":" 4 Cornflowers => Fire Resistance\\n 4 Oxeye Daisies => Absorption\\n 8 Sweetberries => Weak Instant Health\\n 2 Sugar => Speed\\n 4 Poppies => Poison\\n 4 Spider Eyes => Weak harming\\n 1 Fermented Spider eye => Strong harming 16 Kelp => Weakness","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":" 1 Phantom Membrane => Slow Falling\\n 4 Sunflower => Strong healing\\n 4 Bone => Bone Broth\\n 4 Azure Bluet => Regeneration\\n 1 Golden Apple => Strong Regeneration  If you\'re into fletching, then the fletching table can be used to tip arrows with many of these","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"these potions, just place some arrows and the potion on the table and let it do its work.  \\n\\nThe cauldron can be used for crafting wool and fur armour too, just mix in 5 of the required material for a helmet, 8 for a chestplate, 7 for leggings, and 4 for","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"boots. Remember, the cauldron required precise amounts of materials, and deviation and whatever you try to make will fail and you\'ll have to start again.","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Favour","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nCompleting tasks for the Spirits will grant you favour. This is very useful, as it can be used to upgrade your totem\'s power or acquire special outfits you can take with you when you leave this hellhole. These tasks often involve fetching","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"items, killing mobs, or completing dungeons. They are each quite varied and provide different amounts of favour depending on their difficulty. Each player has their favour displayed below their name, as well as in the player list. When you want to spend some favour, type in the command","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"/trigger FavourShop to bring it up, then click on on the desired item\'s price to purchase it! If you\'re too much of a loser to buy something, then it will say so in chat. ","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Dungeons","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nIf you are daring enough, you may want to venture out into the Glaciers in search of the Snowflake and the Lost Station dungeons. The Snowflake is a very dangerous dungeon, said to be the home of an Iceologer who is creating and","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"spreading Blue Ice across the continent. Defeat him to gain great Favour with the Spirits, but be careful, he is incredibly dangerous and his domain is guarded by an army of Frosty Evokers and Pillagers! \\n\\nThe Lost Station is said to be an old research station said","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','{"text":"to be a joint venture of the US and Canada, but was destroyed when the Iceologer\'s armies attacked it and captured their researcher. If he\'s still alive, he would likely be more than happy to share some of his top secret technology with you.","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Other Information","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nIf you have your sneak settings set to \\"toggle\\" rather than \\"hold\\", you may use /trigger ToggleSneak to turn on a setting that lets you still use the double-tap sneak feature to activate your animal totem.   Other useful triggers","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}]','{"text":"include /trigger GetFavour to see your favour total at any time, though this can also be seen in the player list by holding tab (default). You can also use /trigger WinterHelp to get another copy of this book at any time.\\n\\nI also strongly recommend that you","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}}','[{"text":"use a resource pack I created for this event, which you can download ","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"yellow"}]}},{"text":"here","underlined":true,"hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"Download the TNS Winter Event Resource pack","color":"light_purple"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"open_url","value":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/18SpHEZJxhzOMYD8QAV8prxNXq0fT-bb2/view?usp=sharing"}},{"text":". It includes textures for the Iceologer, as well as a custom texture for leather armour to make it appear as fur armour.\\n\\nGood luck and have fun adventurer!","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}}]','[{"text":"<<","color":"light_purple","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]},"clickEvent":{"action":"change_page","value":"1"}},{"text":" Credits","color":"dark_blue","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nCreated by TheDeathlyCow","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nSpawn and Mountain Research Station by _H3rbu_","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nFur armour textures by ShadowsCrow","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}},{"text":"\\n\\nIceologer texture by ewanhowell5195","color":"black","hoverEvent":{"action":"show_text","contents":[{"text":"","color":"light_purple"}]}}]']}
